articles.title: „Bloody Mary“ verzichtete auf das Vierteilen. Ketzer wurden verbrannt
articles.image_title: Anglican bishops Hugh Latimer (1487 - 1555) and Nicholas Ridley (1500 - 1555), two of the Oxford Martyrs, are burned at the stake outside the city walls of Oxford, 16th October 1555. Both had been judged guilty of heresy against the Roman Catholic faith and were executed in the Marian persecutions during the reign of Mary I of England. The third of the Oxford Martyrs, Thomas Cranmer, was burned the following March. Engraving by Taylor. (Photo by Hulton Archive/Getty Images) Getty ImagesGetty Images
